description.plain:
Grammy-winning R&B singer, rapper, dancer, graffiti artist, illustrator and the first male lead artist to have his debut single top the Billboard Hot 100 in 8 years with “Run It!” in 2005, Breezy is undoubtedly a multifaceted artist. To add to this, he is the father of Royalty, a princess and the inspiration for his 7th studio album Royalty.

It’s undeniable his ability as a musician, dancer, and all-round entertainer. At the 54th Annual Grammy Awards (February 12th, 2012) his 4th studio album F.A.M.E. won the award for Best R&B Album and a huge number of other awards and nominations ranging from his debut as a 16 year old in 2005 to his most recent projects.

Brown’s career is long-lived, pristine and all about his music with hits such as “Look At Me Now,” “Turn Up the Music,” and “Loyal,” and successful collaborations with Omarion on his hit “Post to Be” and Lil Dicky's “Freaky Friday” in recent years.

His sixth album X was due to be released near to the end of 2013 but was pushed back due to Chris having to attend to his legal troubles and serve a stint in rehab. It was eventually released during the summer of 2014. Following X, Chris and Tyga released the follow up to their 2010 mixtape Fan of a Fan at the beginning of 2015, titled Fan of a Fan: The Album. The album spawned the hits “Ayo” and “Bitches N Marijuana.”

In 2017, Chris released his own autobiographical movie Welcome to My Life. The movie which was directed by Andrew Listerman provided an insightful look into his life about his music, living in the spotlight and his relationships along with interviews by other musical stars including Usher, Jamie Foxx and more.

In late 2017, Brown made history again by becoming the 10th most certified artist in RIAA single history. He also has totaled over 74 million sales plus streaming units between his singles and albums combined and earning 40 RIAA plaques in 2017 alone.

In February 2018, Brown announced a joint project with rapper Joyner Lucas, titled Angels and Demons. As of March 2019, there’s no set release date for the album, but three singles have been released: “Stranger Things,” “I Don’t Die” and “Just Let Go.”

songs.title_with_featured: Look at Me Now (Ft. Busta Rhymes & Lil Wayne)

description.plain:
“Look At Me Now” is a braggadocious track featuring rap veterans Busta Rhymes and Lil Wayne and is Chris' first rap-centered single to be released. The track was released as the second single from Chris' F.A.M.E..

The mid-tempo record features a modern sounding beat produced by Afrojack and Diplo and an extremely impressive verse by Busta, both of which has been praised by most of the hip-hop community and the reviewers.

“Look At Me Now” performed well in the charts, peaking at #1 on Billboard’s Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs, Hot Rap Songs and Rhythmic Songs charts, at #6 on the Top 100 chart.

songs.title: No Guidance

description.plain:
“No Guidance” is the long-anticipated collaborative single between superstars Chris and Drake. The R&B record finds both artists tapping into their melodic sides as they sing about a girl who’s “got it.”

The collaboration was initially teased by Chris on his Instagram stories and later previewed at a nightclub during Chris' 30th birthday party.

Despite having been at odds previously—due to an incident at a nightclub in June, 2012—the two artists reconciled in 2018 via Instagram and later on stage when Drake brought Chris out at his L.A. tour stop.

While this is the first time they are collaborating on a single as non-featured artists, they have appeared together on two tracks. Drake was featured on Chris' “Deuces (Remix).” Later on, they were both featured on Nicki Minaj’s 2014 track “Only”.

songs.title: Love More

description.plain:
“Love More” is a hard-hitting, playful track about sex. The track was released as the third single from X and was previewed during a performance at the 2013 BET Awards alongside Nicki Minaj, with the title later confirmed via Twitter.

“Love More” charted well in the United States, peaking at #23 on the Hot 100 chart. The track marks the third collaboration between Chris and Nicki, following April 2012’s “Take It to the Head.”

body.plain:
“Love More” is a hard-hitting, playful track about sex. The track was released as the third single from X and was previewed during a performance at the 2013 BET Awards alongside Nicki Minaj, with the title later confirmed via Twitter.

“Love More” charted well in the United States, peaking at #23 on the Hot 100 chart. The track marks the third collaboration between Chris and Nicki, following April 2012’s “Take It to the Head.”

songs.title: Autumn Leaves

description.plain:
In “Autumn Leaves,” Chris is clinging to the remnants of his relationship in an attempt to save it. He shows a vulnerable side in the melancholic track, pleading with his lover to stay. In a September 2013 interview with SKEE TV, Chris revealed that Lamar wrote his verse from the “mindset of a critic” who was coaching Chris through the song. in addition, Chris also praised Lamar’s lyricism and ability to paint a picture with his words.

“Autumn Leaves” was never released as a single, but a music video was shot for the track in Hawaii, with Chris' on-off girlfriend Karreuche Tran as the leading lady. This may allude to the fact that the track was written about their relationship.

“Autumn Leaves” marks the second collaboration between Chris and Kenny, following March 2013’s “R.I.P. (Remix)”.

 the single itself was released earlier on the 4th of August 2017, following the success of earning two gold plaques for ‘Privacy’ and ‘Grass Ain’t Greener’ and a platinum plaque ‘Party’ featuring Usher and Gucci Mane.

‘Pills & Automobiles’ features Yo Gotti, A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie and Kodak Black.

songs.title: Grass Ain’t Greener

description.plain:
The first single from Chris' ninth album Heartbreak on a Full Moon released on May 5th—Chris' birthday. Breezy style gives the gift of new music.

Chris originally posted the song on his Instagram in a series of videos in which he was dancing and vibing to the track in the studio.

The past 12 months have been especially busy for Chris—he released the Before the Party mixtape in November,  followed up with his eight studio album, Royalty, then released Before Da Trap: Nights in Trazana in April 2016.

Perhaps Chris is trying to make up for the long awaited X?

https://twitter.com/chrisbrown/status/728067178222718976

songs.title: New Flame

description.plain:
In “New Flame,” Chris encourages his love interest to be open to starting a new relationship with him. It was initially released as a promotional single from X, with the single version including Usher’s vocals, becoming the fifth single from the album.

“New Flame” charted well, claiming the #1 spots on the R&B/Hip-Hop Airplay chart and Rhytmic Songs chart and also peaking at #27 on the Hot 100 chart.

“New Flame” marks the first collaboration between Chris and Usher. The track marks the fifth collaboration between Chris and Ross, following April 2012’s “Take It to the Head.”

songs.title: Deuces

description.plain:
“Deuces” is a break-up song and the name stems from the term “chucking deuces” which is slang for saying goodbye. In the lyrics, Kevin elaborates on its meaning: raising a middle finger first and then the index finger to say “peace out.” The track was released as a single from Chris and Tyga’s collaborative mixtape, Fan of a Fan, and also appeared on Chris' Grammy-winning album, F.A.M.E.

“Deuces” peaked at #6 on Billboard’s Hot 100 chart and claimed the #1 spot on the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart where it stayed for 9 weeks. “Deuces” also marked Chris' first #1 single since 2006’s “Say Goodbye.”

Rick Ross, Drake, T.I., Kanye West, Fabolous and André 3000 all joined forces to assist on the official remix of the track.

songs.title: Don’t Think They Know

description.plain:
“Don’t Think They Know” is an appreciation track to both Chris' and Aaliyah’s fans, as confirmed by Chris in a June 2013 tweet. The track was released as the second single from X and features posthumous vocals from R&B singer Aaliyah, taken from a 2001 collaboration with Digital Black.

The music video for “Don’t Think They Know” was shot in Los Angeles and includes heavy red and blue imagery, a nod towards two of LA’s notorious gangs, the Bloods and the Crips. Aaliyah appears as a hologram in the video, using clips  from previously released music videos, August 1996’s “If Your Girl Only Knew” and February 2000’s “Try Again.”

“Don’t Think They Know” charted moderately, peaking at #81 on the Hot 100 chart.

body.plain:
“Don’t Think They Know” is an appreciation track to both Chris' and Aaliyah’s fans, as confirmed by Chris in a June 2013 tweet. The track was released as the second single from X and features posthumous vocals from R&B singer Aaliyah, taken from a 2001 collaboration with Digital Black.

The music video for “Don’t Think They Know” was shot in Los Angeles and includes heavy red and blue imagery, a nod towards two of LA’s notorious gangs, the Bloods and the Crips. Aaliyah appears as a hologram in the video, using clips  from previously released music videos, August 1996’s “If Your Girl Only Knew” and February 2000’s “Try Again.”

“Don’t Think They Know” charted moderately, peaking at #81 on the Hot 100 chart.

description.plain:
“Don’t Check on Me” is the sixth track released from Indigo ahead of its release. The mellow, guitar-driven track sees Chris reflect on a past relationship and not wanting his ex to call him to check up on him.

The track features Canadian singer Justin Bieber and is the fifth collaboration between the duo. The track also features vocals from female vocalist Ink, marking the first collaboration between Chris and Ink.

songs.title: Don’t Judge Me

description.plain:
“Don’t Judge Me” is an emotional and vulnerable ballad that sees Chris beg his partner to not judge him on his past mistakes. In the track, Chris also tries to convince his partner that he is faithful. The track is presumed to be written about Chris' former girlfriends Rihanna and Karreuche Tran—who Chris admitted to dating at the same time, baring similarities to the song’s lyrics.

“Don’t Judge Me” performed moderately in the charts, peaking at #3 on the R&B/Hip-Hop Airplay chart and #18 on the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart.

songs.title: Back to Sleep

description.plain:
“Back to Sleep” is the third single to be released from Chris Brown’s 7th album named after his daughter Royalty (following “Liquor” and “Zero”).

The song deals with Chris flying back into town – presumably from touring the country – and going over to see his girl. It’s not alike his past love songs; such as “With You”, but is a lot more subtle in its sexual content than other hits like “Ayo”.

songs.title: Questions

description.plain:
On “Questions,” Chris Brown taps into his nostalgic side and interpolates Kevin Lyttle’s debut 2003 single “Turn Me On,” revamping the dancehall classic and putting his own spin on it.

“Questions” was supposed to be released along with “Pills & Automobiles” as part of the “SINGLE(S)  DROPPING THIS WEEK” in the first week of August. However, due to setbacks with his record label, it was delayed in its release, despite a music video already being shot before “Pills & Automobiles” was released.

The song leaked online a week before its actual release, though, with iTunes versions appearing online on August 11th. It’s believed that the track was prematurely released onto iTunes in select countries before being taken down. With these versions, the cover art was simply a black picture.
